Package application

Class Date

java.lang.Object
application.Date
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<Date>
public class Date
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Date>
The date class helps with verifying if a given date is accurate (i.e. not too old and not an impossibly made up one).
Author:
Ceceliachollette-Dickson, Nidaansari

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Date()
    This constructor returns todayâ€™s date and also helps with checking if the given hire date of an employee is any later than the current (which shouldn't be possible).
    Date​(java.lang.String date)
    This parameterized constructor is taking a string in mm/dd/yyyy and creates a Date object that the user can input in a similar format.

    private boolean isLeapYear​(int year)
    A helper method used to make it easier to discern if a year is a leap year, which means an extra day for February, or not.
    boolean isValid()
    This method is used to help verify that the date given, which is representing when an employee was hired, is not imaginary/impossible or even older than from 1900.
    static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
    We designed the test cases to thoroughly test the isValid() method in this testbed main.

    This method obtains the month, day an year variables of a date and returns a string variable to be processed and compared.

  • Constructor Details

    • Date

      public Date​(java.lang.String date)
      This parameterized constructor is taking a string in mm/dd/yyyy and creates a Date object that the user can input in a similar format.
      Parameters:
      date - of type String to create Date object

    • Date

      public Date()
      This constructor returns todayâ€™s date and also helps with checking if the given hire date of an employee is any later than the current (which shouldn't be possible).

  • Method Details

    • getMonth

      public int getMonth()
      Our getter method to help obtain the int value that represents a date's month.
      Returns:
      the month as an integer

    • getDay

      public int getDay()
      Our getter method that helps obtain the int value that represents a date's day.
      Returns:
      the day as an integer

    • getYear

      public int getYear()
      Our getter method that helps obtain the int value that represents a date's year.
      Returns:
      the year as an integer

    • isLeapYear

      private boolean isLeapYear​(int year)
      A helper method used to make it easier to discern if a year is a leap year, which means an extra day for February, or not.
      Parameters:
      year - of type integer that represents the date's year
      Returns:
      boolean true if the year is a leap year, false otherwise

    • isValid

      public boolean isValid()
      This method is used to help verify that the date given, which is representing when an employee was hired, is not imaginary/impossible or even older than from 1900.
      Returns:
      boolean true if the date not too old and realistic, false otherwise

    • toString

      public java.lang.String toString()
      This method obtains the month, day an year variables of a date and returns a string variable to be processed and compared.
      Overrides:
      toString in class java.lang.Object
      Returns:
      a string variable of the month, day and year in mm/dd/yyyy format

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo​(Date date)
      This method is what implements the Comparable functional interface. We are comparing the values of the dates so that they could follow and be compared to relative to real time.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Date>
      Parameters:
      date - is the Date type being compared to another date
      Returns:
      1 if our date is lexicographically greater, -1 if otherwise, 0 if they are equal

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      We designed the test cases to thoroughly test the isValid() method in this testbed main. The Test Specifications document will exlpain the purpose of each test case. With each date and its respective boolean, there should either be an output that prints the given date or prints the string literal "Invalid Date!"
      Parameters:
      args - array of String argument
